result.execSummary:
The defendant Christy D Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Christy D Scott is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Christy D Scott was found guilty of Maintain Drug Trafficking Place, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Total cost due during length of probation. 
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
No work release authorized by the court.
No contact with Mary Haas or Daron Hardin
AODA assessment and follow up as deemed appropriate.

records.addlTxt: Defendant

Defendant Christy D Scott in court with attorney Olya Petukhova.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.State calls Det. Cory Polishinsky sworn & testified. Cross exam. State requests court take judicial notice of Milw case 03CF5673 felony conviction unreversed and remains of record. State rests. No testimony from defense. State moves for bind over. Defense moves for dismissal. Denied.   Court finds probable cause and orders matter bound over for arraignment. State requests arraignment date. Atty Petukhova files written request for substitution of judge.

Defendant Christy D Scott in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Adam Yale Gerol appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appears by video conferencing from Ozaukee County Jail.  Waive reading of felony complaint. Def does qualify for public defender representation.  State requests $10,000 cash bail. Defense argues for $500 cash bail.   Defendant and/or counsel requests matter be scheduled for preliminary hearing. Timelimits not waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
